title: Keen4 Demo?
content: hmmm, so awhile back before the forum died, there was a topic about a Keen4 demo... some people have claimed to have it.. So.. what happened?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
A few people said they used to have the demo version (or had played it), but, IIRK, none of them still posses it.

According to a [url=http://groups.google.com.au/group/comp.os.ms-windows.nt.setup/browse_frm/thread/58943470b4ade093/c1a7bd58771ace8f?lnk=st&q=k4demo.zip&rnum=1&hl=en#c1a7bd58771ace8f]thread[/url] in Google Groups, the filename for the game's zip archive was k4demo.zip, if anyone's thinking about scouring the internet for a copy of it somewhere.

--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content: I bought the demo version when it first came out, but as far as I can tell it's no different to the registered version...

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content: ive never seen it posted, your right many claim to have it, somebody post it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Mal: I bought the demo version when it first came out, but as far as I can tell it's no different to the registered version...[hr][/quote]
Apparently there's only like, 5 levels in this particular demo. And some of the areas in the map are completly blocked off.

Someone mentioned in the other thread that the idea behind having a 5-level demo of the shareware episode was for people getting the game from a BBS, so they wouldn't have to wait as long to download it, IIRK. (That's possibly nothing like what the reason was, but it's what I assume I remember)--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
Yeah, nobody claimed to have it, instead they (and me) were trying to find it. I have some fuzzy memory about seeing this kind of Keen 4 long ago, with only a few levels and some areas entirely blocked, but I can't be 100% sure if the memory is real. I believe there is this kind of demo, yes. I'd like to see it so much..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Apparently there's only like, 5 levels in this particular demo. And some of the areas in the map are completly blocked off.[hr][/quote]

Gah! I *remember* that! I destroyed it as soon as I got the registered version for being low quality!

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
Yeah, I used to have it, but deleted it when I got the normal version from a friend.

It had just a few levels... as far as I can remember the first two villages, the Pyramid of Shadows, the the ice level and the Lifewater Oasis. I also believe there were no sleeping slugs in the walls of the village levels.

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
You can extract the following from Keen 4 by using Modkeen:
[quote]Quote:[hr]^p
^G8,8,13
^c4WHOOPS!
^c8
This level is not available in the Demo Version of "Secret of the Oracle". You can get the complete game by filling out the registration card when you buy Commander Keen in . . .

^c9"Aliens Ate My Baby Sitter!"
^c8
But hey, try out the five levels that are here!
^E[hr][/quote]
I guess this showed up when you tried to enter a level that wasn't available.

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
"It had just a few levels... as far as I can remember the first two villages, the Pyramid of Shadows, the the ice level and the Lifewater Oasis. I also believe there were no sleeping slugs in the walls of the village levels."
Ah.. I remember exactly something like that as well! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

And that stuff extracted with modkeen -- it gives concrete proof that there really was this kinda demo.

We gotta find it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
WOAH!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] The long search is over! This is it! Thanks for informing us!

So cool! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] Time had distorted my memory; I was sure some areas were physically blocked, but now it seems they just displayed that message when you enter them -- which is the way it was, now when I think about it.

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
The same corrupt folder thing happened to me when I used XP's extractor software. WinRAR works, though.

EDIT: Was this demo made while the game was still in development? It feels like it...

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
Yeah, the demo was made when the game was still unfinished so it was merely somekind of pre-release demo. Why otherwise would they have made a demo out of a game if the full version was free?

Anyways this demo version of Keen 4 was distributed as a part of a demo disc that FormGen was selling in Radio Shack in order to promote Keen 6.

Any hackers out there willing to dig into the files? I'm sure there has to be some beta stuff hidden within the mysterious files.

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
It's looks like an old PKZip 1.1 file, because when you extract it you can see all the old compression methods - most ZIPs nowadays contain 'deflated' files, whereas this zip contains 'shrunk' and 'imploded' files - which I'm guessing haven't been implemented in every .ZIP extractor out there...

I recompressed it as a [url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/1keen4_v2.zip]newer .ZIP file[/url] if anyone needs it - this should work everywhere.

There are a lot of extra files in there - the help text that's displayed when you press F1 is all stored in external files, which is interesting - but I guess you can probably extract all that from the newer Keens anyway.

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
Hmm, interesting, I have PKZip204e

Ah the origionals! Joy!


Hmmm, interesting it appears its partially modkeenized, with those little textfiles that show all the story, help, etc text. If we can study how this demo is different from the full version, we may just be able to make editable external story etc files!




A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Keen4 Demo?
content:
Hmmm, interesting, the art seems to be split up into several sections

That's what I thought, but nope - try opening those *ART.CK4 files in Notepad. DEMOART.CK4 is the text saying "This level is unavailable in the demo."
